0.2.5

Windows 11

In the git tab the filename overflows when it is to long.

title: Feature request: folding
body:
I recently started using lapce and the absence of a folding system for loops and functions makes it hard to work on long files.
I think it could be a pretty good feature to be able to fold individual brackets pairs.

title: Same name files in ssh session

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version

0.2.5

## System information

Ubuntu 22.04

## Describe the bug

If you open two different files in two different directories that have same name from a remote session (ssh) and then close and reopen Lapce, the app looses directories of the files and issues this error in console :

`failed parsing jsdoc LapceLanguage: Matching variant not found`

As a result editing and saving any of those files is not possible and any attempt to save the file will freeze the ssh console too.

title: User configurable diff context lines
body: Currently, the number of diff context lines is hardcoded to 3 in [lapce-core/src/buffer/mod.rs](https://github.com/lapce/lapce/blob/e686e6f999c593aadde3dd37b1dafcfd739095d9/lapce-core/src/buffer/mod.rs#L1205-L1246). This should be user-configurable. Also, it should be configurable to disable line skipping at all (like infinite context lines) by skipping the whole `if !changes.is_empty()` block.

title: Remove spaces created by auto-indentation if the line is skipped
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

If you have indentation (4 spaces), when you press Enter, the next line will lead with 4 spaces. But if you press Enter again (essentially skipping the line), the 4 spaces in the previous (skipped) line remain.

## Describe the solution you'd like

Apply indentation only to the current line, and remove it from previous lines unless something is written in them.

## Describe alternatives you've considered

I tried to find some setting, but I couldn't.

## Additional context

In VS Code, the skipped indented lines have their spaces removed.
In Lapce, they remain, so you are left with a bunch of whitespace which serves nothing and wastes memory.
(\n\n\n) vs (\n    \n    \n)

Lapce:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/120663193/212849508-e8ad168a-ef61-4f9f-94e2-15dd06b4c635.png)

VS Code:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/120663193/212849715-c79e546d-4a50-4f59-9a77-4b1d00bd380e.png)

title: Cannot map key  `Ctrl`+`[` to "Modal close" action

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version

Reproduced in master at aa66b3f6d50080be32a8489e25d7edea56af4e53.

## System information

Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS

## Describe the bug
Trying to set  `Ctrl`+`[`  as a shortcut for "Close Modal" in the GUI does not work.
Instead, the "outdent line" action is performed.
The default key `Escape` still works for closing modal.

**Note**: in normal terminals, `Ctrl`+`[` (i.e. `^[`) is treated the same as the `Escape` key, which I normally use in Vim.
https://www.systutorials.com/docs/linux/man/4-console_codes/

## Additional information

The GUI generates `keymaps.toml`:
```toml
[[keymaps]]
command = "modal.close"
when = "modal_focus"
key = "Ctrl+["

[[keymaps]]
command = "-modal.close"
when = "modal_focus"
key = "Escape"
```

Possible issues:
* Having more than one key map to the same action
* Adding a shortcut that conflicts with built-in shortcuts

title: Combinable Code Lens and Diff
body:
Currently, the editor supports the distinct views `Normal`, `Diff`, and `Lens`. However, `Diff` and `Lens` are actually orthogonal to each other. It would be useful to combine them, so changes in function signatures for example could be spotted easily while still having an overview how much was changed inside the functions.

The implementation would need to apply the Code Lens on the Left and the Right version and display each line in the size according to its corresponding lens.

title: Selectable `DiffResult::Left` text
body:
Sometimes you need to reinsert some parts of the original code into the new code. Selection and copy of the original (`DiffResult::Left`) code from the diff view would make this straight-forward. Currently, these lines are invisible for selection.

The behavior for selections starting on `DiffResult::Both` or `DiffResult::Right` should remain. When placing the cursor or starting selection on `DiffResult::Left`, the other side (`DiffResult::Right`) should become invisible for this specific selection.

Additionally, when pressing the `Down` or `Up` keys (without selection), I think all lines should be considered. But this isn't really important as long as the selection can be started on `DiffResult::Left` with the mouse.

This will make it impossible to select fragments of the original code that do not start or end inside modified lines. This limitation could be fixed intuitively when there is an option to enable side-by-side diffs.

title: chore(deps): bump image from 0.24.4 to 0.24.5

labels.name: Dependency
labels.description: This issue is most likely a problem in one of the dependencies

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [image](https://github.com/image-rs/image) from 0.24.4 to 0.24.5.
Changelog

Sourced from image's changelog.

Version 0.24.5

Structural changes:

  • Increased the minimum supported Rust version (MSRV) to 1.61.
  • Increased the version requirement for the tiff crate to 0.8.0.
  • Increased the version requirement for the jpeg crate to 0.3.0.

Bug fixes:

  • The as_rgb32f function of DynamicImage is now correctly documented.
  • Fixed a crash when decoding ICO images. Added a regression test.
  • Fixed a panic when transforming webp images. Added a regression test.
  • Added a check to prevent integer overflow when calculating file size for BMP images. The missing check could panic in debug mode or else set an incorrect file size in release mode.
  • Upgraded the PNG image encoder to use the newer PngEncoder::write_image instead of the deprecated PngEncoder::encode which did not account for byte order and could result in images with incorrect colors.
  • Fixed InsufficientMemory error when trying to decode a PNG image.
  • Fix warnings and CI issues.
  • Typos and links in the documentation have been corrected.

Performance:

  • Added check for dynamic image dimensions before resizing. This improves performance in cases where the image does not need to be resized or has already been resized.
Commits
  • aa1e81e Changes and release notes for 0.24.5
  • 88aadcb Merge pull request #1821 from micahsnyder/bump-jpeg-dependency
  • dffefce Bump the 'jpeg' version requirement to 0.3.0
  • bf0a96b Merge pull request #1812 from fintelia/png-with-limits
  • a7026e9 Merge pull request #1817 from Flashover89/Check-dimensions-for-dyn-image-befo...
  • 392798c Fix white spacing
  • 2be3d17 Merge branch 'image-rs:master' into Check-dimensions-for-dyn-image-before-res...
  • 4681225 Fix review findings
  • 1361f4a Add PngDecoder::with_limits
  • 1878c88 Merge pull request #1815 from fintelia/fix-ci
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=image&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.24.4&new-version=0.24.5)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Manually select file encoding, inline mode and end line characters
body:
I wish to be able to see and configure the inline mode, file encoding and end of line characters to an open file.
This is both useful for not having to set these options manually with the use of a separate editor. It can also prevent incompatibility issues. (Such as Linux bash files not accepting CRLF line ending)

Setting a default for these options globally or specifically to a file type would also be convenient. 

Screenshot of vscodium (Visual Studio Code):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75360760/212091896-eae2d034-d255-4bae-a771-2177216a3ff4.png)

title: Window dragging doesn't work on windows when primary mouse button is switched

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: Category: bug - something isn't working as it's supposed to

body:
## Lapce Version

2.5.0

## System information

Windows 10

## Describe the bug

The bug only applies when "Custom Titlebar" is ON.

When the primary mouse button is switched in windows settings to the RIGHT button, Lapce window dragging doesn't work. Everything else works fine, only the window dragging is bugged.

And by "it doesn't work" I mean pressing and dragging the mouse on the window title doesn't do anything - the window doesn't move. Window resizing works fine.

## Additional information

Disabling the "custom titlebar" in Lapce settings is a workaround.

Switching the primary button back to the LEFT button fixes the issue. This is where you can find the primary mouse button settings on Windows 10:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2076742/211997822-fed96f2f-12f5-4e9e-b170-291153d3475b.png)

title: Settings Profile Support

labels.name: A-lsp
labels.description: Area: LSP, assists and code completion

body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I have multiple toolchains that use different LSP servers. For example, when compiling with the msvc toolchain, I'm using clang-cl with a clangd installation somewhere in `C:\Program Files\LLVM\bin`. When compiling with MSYS2, I'm using UCRT/Clang64 with a clangd located in `C:\Users\computerquip\tools\msys64\clang64\bin\clangd.exe`. I don't seem to have a convenient way to switch between these two locations (and their associated arguments) when I need to use one over the other.

## Describe the solution you'd like
The word "profiles" comes to mind where you can just select a profile that changes out certain settings.  I think this is what vscode does but not sure.

## Other Problems
Even if such a feature is provided, I'd be surprised if there wasn't difficulty by just switching settings since it would require rebuilding the LSP database which probably isn't ideal. Maybe need data to be contextual to the profile, so if you switch profiles, it also knows where to find the database that was generated with that profile. This sounds like a can of worms when you have a bunch of different profiles and probably is. I'm unsure how vscode solves this (or if they try to solve it at all).

Anyways, I feel like this is a pretty petty feature request.

title: Autosave highlight flickering
body:
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

When autosave is enabled the flickering of errors/warnings highlighting is very distracting

## Describe the solution you'd like

Either have an option to not rerun the code checker on autosave like the formater option or adjust the timing so that the highlight stays there and just the text changes (or higlight color). In my opinion implementing both of these as options will be good.
